intro: Epidendrum subliberum, commonly known as the orange-flowered Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, racemose inflorescences that bear numerous showy, orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy surface to reduce water loss. Epidendrum subliberum is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to cultivation.
